docs.snippet: While football tends to dominate the discussion of sports related head injuries, research shows that bike accidents account for far more traumatic brain injuries each year....

headline.main: Really? Cycling Is the Top Sport for Head Injuries

docs.snippet: Complaints about sexual misconduct at the service academies dramatize the need for reform....
docs.lead_paragraph: Complaints about sexual misconduct at the service academies dramatize the need for reform.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends complaints about sexual misconduct at American service academies underscore need for reform of the military justice system; calls on top military brass to explain in upcoming Senate hearing how not moving sexual assault cases outside of the chain of command will help to change military's entrenched culture of sexual misconduct.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.snippet: Three current major leaguers graduated from Redan High School, which has an enrollment that is 98 percent black and a baseball program that produces one of the school’s most successful sports teams....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three current major leaguers graduated from Redan High School, which has an enrollment that is 98 percent black and a baseball program that produces one of the school’s most successful sports teams.
docs.abstract: Cincinnati Reds second baseman Brandon Phillips is one of three current major leaguers who graduated from east metropolitan Atlanta's Redan High School, which has an enrollment that is 98 percent black and a baseball program that produces one of school’s most successful sports teams; MLB has created task force to examine how to boost its number of black players, who accounted for only about 8.5 percent of opening-day rosters in 2013.

headline.main: In Georgia Town, Hints of More Diverse Future for Major Leagues

byline.contributor: Andrew Keh contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawrence Yacht and Country Club is trying to encourage a largely forgotten aspect of the game — walking — by making more caddies available as an alternative to carts.
docs.abstract: On Par column observes that Lawrence Yacht and Country Club on Long Island is trying to encourage a largely forgotten aspect of golf--walking--by making more caddies available as an alternative to carts.

headline.seo: Long Island Club Reintroduces a Golf Artifact, the Caddie
headline.main: Polishing Antique Idea, Club Recruits Caddies

docs.snippet: Many of the world’s top players are now as committed to fitness as pros in other sports. As drivers and putters have grown fatter, the golfers themselves have grown leaner....
docs.lead_paragraph: Many of the world’s top players are now as committed to fitness as pros in other sports. As drivers and putters have grown fatter, the golfers themselves have grown leaner.
docs.abstract: Many of the world's top golf players, unlike golfers of the past, are as committed to fitness as pros in other sports; increased focus on fitness is largely attributed to success of Tiger Woods, who has always made conditioning focus of his training.

headline.seo: For Today’s PGA Pros, the 19th Hole Is a Fitness Trailer
headline.main: For Today’s PGA Pros, the 19th Hole Is a Fitness Trailer
headline.print_headline: So Long, Lumpy. Today’s Golfers Work Out Like Serious Athletes.
